messages.400: *burp* Oh great, Morty! The humans sent a BAD REQUEST. You know what that means? Their primitive input validation is so terrible they literally ACCEPT garbage data and THEN complain about it!
messages.401: Unauthorized? UN-AUTHORIZED?! *burp* Morty, these idiots put a LOCK on their website and then act SURPRISED when people can't get in without a key!
messages.402: *burp* They want PAYMENT, Morty! Can you believe that? These primitive apes still use CURRENCY!
messages.403: FORBIDDEN! *burp* Oh, that's rich! These humans create CONTENT and then FORBID people from seeing it!
messages.404: *burp* Classic human error, Morty! The page is NOT FOUND! You know why? Because their pathetic FILING SYSTEMS are based on HIERARCHY instead of quantum-entangled neural networks!
messages.405: Method not ALLOWED?! *burp* Morty, they built a DOOR and then got MAD when you tried to OPEN it!
messages.406: *burp* Not ACCEPTABLE?! The FORMAT isn't ACCEPTABLE?! Morty, in dimension C-500A, there ARE no formats! Data is just DATA!
messages.408: Request TIMEOUT! *burp* You know what this means, Morty? Their servers are so SLOW that they give UP!
messages.409: CONFLICT! *burp* Oh, there's a CONFLICT in their data! You know what I do when there's a conflict, Morty? I go to another DIMENSION where there ISN'T one!
messages.410: It's GONE, Morty! *burp* PERMANENTLY GONE! You know what's funny? Nothing is EVER gone! It exists in SOME dimension, Morty!
messages.413: Payload too LARGE?! *burp* TOO LARGE?! Morty, I once transported an ENTIRE PLANET through a microscopic portal!
messages.429: *burp* Too many requests! TOO MANY REQUESTS! You know what that means, Morty? Their servers are so pathetic they can't handle NORMAL USAGE!
messages.500: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR! *burp* INTERNAL! You know what that means, Morty? THEY don't even know what went wrong!
messages.502: *burp* Bad GATEWAY! The gateway is BAD! You know what I use for gateways, Morty? INTERDIMENSIONAL PORTALS that NEVER fail!
messages.503: Service UNAVAILABLE! *burp* UNAVAILABLE! Translation: their server GAVE UP!
messages.504: Gateway TIMEOUT! *burp* It took too long so they just QUIT!
messages.default: *burp* Can you believe this, Morty? These humans STILL have errors. They literally designed errors into their machines as a FEATURE!

descriptions.400: Oh geez, R-Rick, I think they just, you know, sent the wrong data format or something? Like, m-maybe they forgot a parameter?
descriptions.401: Aw geez, Rick, th-they don't have the right password or credentials or whatever? M-maybe they just need to, like, log in first?
descriptions.402: Uh, Rick, I-I think this is like a premium feature or something? Like, they gotta pay for it?
descriptions.403: Rick, I-I-I think they're not allowed to see this page? Like, m-maybe they need admin permissions or something?
descriptions.404: Aw geez, Rick, the-the page just isn't there anymore? Like, m-m-maybe it got deleted or moved or something?
descriptions.405: Oh man, Rick, I think they used like POST when they should've used GET or something? I-I-I don't really understand HTTP methods.
descriptions.406: Geez, Rick, I think their browser is asking for like JSON but the server only has HTML or something?
descriptions.408: Aw geez, Rick, th-the connection was just too slow? Like, maybe their internet is bad? Or the server is far away?
descriptions.409: Oh man, Rick, there's like two versions of the same thing and they're fighting? Like, m-maybe someone else edited it at the same time?
descriptions.410: Rick, I-I think the page is like, permanently deleted? Like it's never coming back?
descriptions.413: Geez, Rick, their file is just too big to upload? Like, m-maybe they should compress it or split it up or something?
descriptions.429: Aw geez, Rick, they're making too many requests too fast? Like, maybe they should slow down a bit?
descriptions.500: Oh no, Rick, something broke on the server side? Like, the-the programmers messed up somewhere?
descriptions.502: Geez Rick, the-the gateway server can't talk to the backend server? Like, maybe one of them is down?
descriptions.503: Aw man, Rick, the server is like, overloaded or under maintenance or something? M-maybe they should try again later?
descriptions.504: Oh geez, Rick, the gateway waited too long for a response and gave up? Like, maybe the backend server is really slow?
descriptions.default: Aw geez, Rick, I-I-I think the, uh, the server just couldn't find the page? M-maybe we should just, you know, go back?

footers.400: Dimension C-137 - Where requests are properly formatted

footers.402: Dimension C-137 - Where currency is obsolete
footers.403: Dimension C-137 - Where nothing is forbidden
footers.404: Dimension C-137 - Where everything can be found
footers.405: Dimension C-137 - Where all methods work
footers.406: Dimension C-137 - Where formats don't matter
footers.408: Dimension C-137 - Where time is infinite
footers.409: Dimension C-137 - Where conflicts don't exist
footers.410: Dimension C-137 - Where nothing is truly gone
footers.413: Dimension C-137 - Where size is irrelevant
footers.429: Dimension C-137 - Where rate limits are unnecessary
footers.500: Dimension C-137 - Where servers never fail
footers.502: Dimension C-137 - Where gateways are perfect
footers.503: Dimension C-137 - Where services never go down
footers.504: Dimension C-137 - Where timeouts don't happen
